perturbation.original_text: This amendment to Section 2 (titled "Term"), Part B of the Co-Branding Agreement is made effective December 9, 1996 by and between PC Quote, Inc. (hereinafter referred to as "PCQ") and A.B. Watley, Inc. (hereinafter referred to as "ABW"), who are also the parties contracted in the aforementioned Co-Branding Agreement. This Amendment shall apply to said PCQ and ABW and all of their subsidiaries and related companies.
perturbation.changed_text: This amendment to Section 2 (titled "Term"), Part B of the Co-Branding Agreement is made effective December 9, 1996 by and between PC Quote, Inc. (hereinafter referred to as "PCQ") and A.B. Watley, Inc. (hereinafter referred to as "ABW"), who are also the parties contracted in the aforementioned Co-Branding Agreement. This Amendment shall apply only to PCQ and ABW, and not to any of their subsidiaries or related companies.
perturbation.explanation: This creates a contradiction. The original text states the amendment applies to PCQ, ABW, and all their subsidiaries/related companies. The modified text limits the application to only PCQ and ABW, excluding the subsidiaries and related companies. This creates uncertainty regarding which entities are bound by the amendment.

perturbation.original_text:
AGREED TO BY:

/s/ Steven Malin /s/ Howard Meltzer - -------------------------- --------------------------------- A.B. Watley, Inc. PC Quote, Inc. Mr. Steven Malin Mr. Howard Meltzer Director President Date:  12/5/96 Date:   12/12/96      -------------- ----------------

Source: PCQUOTE COM INC, S-1/A, 7/21/1999
perturbation.changed_text:
AGREED TO BY:

/s/ Steven Malin /s/ Howard Meltzer - -------------------------- --------------------------------- A.B. Watley, Inc. PC Quote, Inc. Mr. Steven Malin Mr. Howard Meltzer Director President Date:  12/5/96 Date:   12/12/96      -------------- ----------------

Notwithstanding the above, this agreement becomes effective January 1, 1997. Source: PCQUOTE COM INC, S-1/A, 7/21/1999
perturbation.explanation: The signature section indicates the agreement was executed in December 1996. By adding 'Notwithstanding the above, this agreement becomes effective January 1, 1997,' a contradiction is introduced. It's unclear if the effective date is December 1996 (date of signatures) or January 1997, causing ambiguity regarding when the obligations under the agreement begin.
